title: BWH Egg Freezing Counseling Tool (EFCT)
description: Predicts likelihood of live birth for elective egg freezing in women. Developed by Brigham and Women's Hospital to provide evidence-based counseling for women considering elective egg freezing by predicting the probability of at least one, two, or three live births based on age and number of mature eggs.

parameters.name: age
parameters.description: Woman's age at time of egg freezing

parameters.name: number_of_mature_eggs
parameters.description: Number of mature eggs retrieved and frozen

result.name: live_birth_probabilities
result.description: Predicted probabilities of achieving at least one, two, or three live births

ranges.interpretation: Very low probability of live birth. Consider additional cycles or alternative options.
Low probability of live birth. Additional egg freezing cycles may significantly improve chances.
Moderate probability of live birth. Success is possible but not guaranteed.
Good probability of live birth. Favorable chances of success with current egg count.
Excellent probability of live birth. Very favorable prognosis with current egg count.

references: Goldman RH, Racowsky C, Farland LV, Munné S, Ribustello L, Fox JH. Predicting the likelihood of live birth for elective oocyte cryopreservation: a counseling tool for physicians and patients. Hum Reprod. 2017 Apr 1;32(4):853-859. doi: 10.1093/humrep/dex008.

Doyle JO, Richter KS, Lim J, Stillman RJ, Graham JR, Tucker MJ. Successful elective and medically indicated oocyte vitrification and warming for autologous in vitro fertilization, with predicted birth probabilities for fertility preservation according to number of cryopreserved oocytes and age at retrieval. Fertil Steril. 2016 Feb;105(2):459-66.e2. doi: 10.1016/j.fertnstert.2015.10.026.

Harton GL, Munné S, Surrey M, Grifo J, Kaplan B, McCulloh DH, Griffin DK, Wells D; PGD Practitioners Group. Diminished effect of maternal age on implantation after preimplantation genetic diagnosis with array comparative genomic hybridization. Fertil Steril. 2013 Dec;100(6):1695-703. doi: 10.1016/j.fertnstert.2013.07.2002.
formula: p(Livebirth) = 1 - [1 - 0.6 × p(Euploid) × p(Blast)]^(Number of mature eggs), where p(Blast) and p(Euploid) vary by age
notes: This tool provides estimates based on elective egg freezing in healthy women
May overestimate live birth rates for non-elective egg freezing (e.g., cancer patients)
Less reliable for women aged 39 years and older due to limited data
Assumes standard vitrification techniques and experienced embryology laboratory
Not validated prospectively - based on retrospective data analysis
Results should be used for counseling purposes only, not as guarantees
